Package com.example.mini_pekkas

Class Firebase

java.lang.Object
com.example.mini_pekkas.Firebase
public class Firebase extends Object
This class is used to interface with Firebase and should be used for all Firebase operations. Any functions that get and request data needs a user defined listener. This is a function that's called after an operation is completed. Every listener will have a on success and an optional on error listener (if not overwritten, the default error handling is to print the error in the log)

  • Method Details

    • fetchUserDocument

      public void fetchUserDocument(Firebase.InitializationListener listener)
      This function fetches the user document and stores it in UserDocument This function shouldn't need to be called as the constructor will initialize the user document Call checkThisUserExist first if the existence of the user document is not known
      Parameters:
      listener - An InitializationListener listener that runs on a successful fetch

    • checkThisUserExist

      public void checkThisUserExist(Firebase.CheckListener listener)
      Checks if the user document exists in the firestore.
      Parameters:
      listener - A CheckListener listener that is called when the check is complete. Returns true if the document exists

      public void InitializeThisUser(User user, Firebase.InitializationListener listener)

      Parameters:
      user - A user object to be initialized
      listener - An InitializationListener listener that is called after the user is initialized

      Returns:

    • getEventByStatus

      private void getEventByStatus(String status, Firebase.EventListRetrievalListener listener)
      Gets an ArrayList of events this user is in, specified by the status This function is called by getXEvents() where X is the status
      Parameters:
      status - the status of the events to retrieve. [waitlisted, enrolled, cancelled, organized]
      listener - a EventListRetrievalListener that returns an ArrayList of events

    • getEventByQRCode

      public void getEventByQRCode(String qrCode, Firebase.EventRetrievalListener listener)
      Deprecated.
      The QR code should be decoded into the event id and retrieved using getEvent(String eventID, EventRetrievalListener listener)
      Retrieves an event using its QR code.
      Parameters:
      qrCode - The Base64 encoded QR code string to match.
      listener - An EventRetrievalListener that returns the Event object if found.

      private void uploadProfilePicture(User user, android.net.Uri image, Firebase.DataRetrievalListener listener)
      A private function that stores the profile picture in the storage. This function is called from uploadProfilePicture and should not be invoked directly
      Parameters:
      user - the user object to store the profile picture in
      image - the image to be stored in Uri format
      listener - Optional listener that is called when the image is stored. Returns the image url as a string

      image - the image to be stored in Uri format

    • isProfilePicture

      public void isProfilePicture(String imageName, Firebase.CheckListener listener)
      Checks if the image is a profile picture.
      Parameters:
      imageName - the image name to check
      listener - the listener that is called when the check is complete. Returns true if the image is a profile picture false if poster image, This function should never have to return null as either it exist in one or the other.

    • isProfilePicture

      public void isProfilePicture(android.net.Uri imageUrl, Firebase.CheckListener listener)
      Overload of the isProfilePicture(String, CheckListener) with the imageUri instead of the image name

    • isThisUserAdmin

      public void isThisUserAdmin(Firebase.CheckListener listener)
      Checks if this user is an admin
      Parameters:
      listener - the listener that is called when the check is complete. Returns true if the user is an admin

    • waitForQueryCompletion

      private void waitForQueryCompletion(ArrayList<com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task> tasks, Firebase.QueryRetrievalListener listener)
      Handles the processing of multiple search tasks and ensures all data is retrieved before calling the listener
      Parameters:
      tasks - A list of document snapshots to be processed in the calling function
      listener - QueryRetrievalListener listener that returns an ArrayList of document snapshots. Document snapshots should be processed in the calling function

      public void searchForEvent(String query, Firebase.EventListRetrievalListener listener)

    • searchForUsers

      public void searchForUsers(String query, Firebase.UserListRetrievalListener listener)
      Searches for users in the database, returns an array of users
      Parameters:
      query - the query to search for
      listener - the listener that is called when the search is complete. Returns an ArrayList of users

      Parameters:
      query - the query to search for
      listener - the listener that is called when the search is complete. Returns an ArrayList of facilities
